qas.question: From what direction did Napoleon elect to invade Italy?
What direction did French invasions of Italy normally come from?
Around how long did it take Napoleon to push Austria out of Italy in his first experiences there?
How long did it take Napoleon to drive Austria from Italy in 1800?
According to Alfred von Shlieffen, what was the object of Napoleon's 1800 Italian campaign?

context: Although critics have blamed Napoleon for several tactical mistakes preceding the battle, they have also praised his audacity for selecting a risky campaign strategy, choosing to invade the Italian peninsula from <a0_0>the north<a0_0/> when the vast majority of French invasions came from <a1_0>the west<a1_0/>, near or along the coastline. As Chandler points out, Napoleon spent almost <a2_0>a year<a2_0/> getting the Austrians out of Italy in his first campaign; in 1800, it took him only <a3_0>a month<a3_0/> to achieve the same goal. German strategist and field marshal Alfred von Schlieffen concluded that "Bonaparte did not annihilate his enemy but eliminated him and rendered him harmless" while "[attaining] the object of the campaign: <a4_0>the conquest of North Italy<a4_0/>."
